intro: Aruba cuneata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. Aruba cuneata is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its compact size and long-lasting blooms. It is also valued for its ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper care.
